specificLearningOutcomes: outline the importance of prayer in the life of a Christian
discuss the importance of having faith when one prays to God
demonstrate love by praying for all people as taught by Jesus Christ
apply lessons learnt on prayer by praying to God always
desire to have faith in God whenever they pray
suggestedLearningExperiences: share with peers how they pray to God in day-to-day life
brainstorm on the importance of having faith in God as they pray
read Mark 11:22–24 and share how to pray by faith
read Matthew 5:44-45 and share instances they prayed for both friends and enemies
read Matthew 6:5-8, outline the main teachings and use PowerPoint slides/charts to make presentations
journal their day-to-day prayer life experiences
keyInquiryQuestions: How do you apply the teachings of Jesus Christ in your day-to-day life?

specificLearningOutcomes: analyse God’s love for the sinner as outlined in the parable of the lost sheep
take part in reaching out to the lost through mission work
desire to exemplify God’s love by serving all people
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm on God’s love for the lost
read Luke 15:1-7 and make notes on the parable of the lost sheep
outline lessons learnt from the parable of the lost sheep
role-play the parable of the lost sheep
brainstorm on how to reach out to the sinner
organise a class visit to the less fortunate, give them various items; as a way of sharing God’s love with them
share experiences on how to have a close relationship with God
compose and sing a song on God’s love for the lost
keyInquiryQuestions: How does the parable of the lost sheep show God’s love for the lost?

specificLearningOutcomes: describe the background to the call of Abraham
examine ways Abraham demonstrated faith in God
apply faith in different situations as exemplified by Abraham
analyse the promises made by God to Abraham and their importance to Christians today
apply God’s promises in their day-to-day life
suggestedLearningExperiences: read Genesis 11:24-32, 12:1; discuss and make notes for presentation in class
brainstorm and share with the class the meaning of the word, ‘faith.’
share experiences of how they exercise faith in God
read Hebrews 11:1-6 and make notes in their exercise books or use a digital device
brainstorm on how Abraham demonstrated faith in God
in turns read and discuss Genesis 12:1-3, 15:1-6; 17:23-26, 21:1-7 and 22:1-14
team up to role-play how God tested Abraham’s faith; Genesis 22 1-19
develop a weekly journal on how they exercise faith in God
brainstorm on the meaning of the word, ‘Promises.’
list the promises made by God to Abraham
read Genesis 12: 2-3, 15:1- 6, 17:1-8, 17:15-18 and outline the promises made by God to Abraham for presentation in class
discuss the importance of God’s promises to Christians today
brainstorm on how to apply God’s promises in day-to-day life
keyInquiryQuestions: How do you exercise faith in relation to God’s promises?

specificLearningOutcomes: discuss the meaning of the term ‘covenant’
identify covenants in modern life and their importance
evaluate characteristics of ungodly covenants today
explain the importance of God’s covenant with Abraham
outline the importance of circumcision to Abraham and his descendants
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm the meaning of the term covenant and share findings with the class
team up to brainstorm on modern covenants and their importance and make notes
read and discuss Genesis 15:1-18 and make a presentation to the class using PowerPoint slides or charts
watch a video clip on God’s covenant with Abraham
buzz on characteristics of ungodly covenants today
search/read scriptures on how to distinguish between godly from ungodly covenants
read James 4:7, Mathew 4: 8-10, 1Peter 5:8-9, Mathew 7:15-20 and discuss how to resist/discern ungodly covenants
discuss the importance of God’s covenant with Abraham
read Genesis 17:1- 14 and make notes
discuss the importance of circumcision to Abraham and his descendants
buzz on how to apply faith in difficult situations and share findings with the class
keyInquiryQuestions: Why is Abrahamic covenant important to Christians today?

specificLearningOutcomes: discuss reasons for kingship in Israel
examine reasons against kingship in Israel according to Prophet Samuel
evaluate King Saul’s failures and the consequences
deduce lessons learnt from the failures of King Saul
desire to be a God-fearing leader at home, school and the community
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm in small groups reasons why the Israelites demanded for a king
read 1 Samuel 8: 1-9 and make short notes
conduct an internet or library search on reasons against kingship in Israel
read 1 Samuel 8:10-20 and outline reasons against kingship in Israel
read and discuss king Saul’s failures and the consequences; 1Samuel 13:8-14, 15:7-25
discuss lessons learnt from the failures of King Saul
write a journal on how you exercise leadership at home, school and in the community
keyInquiryQuestions: Why did King Saul fail in his leadership?

specificLearningOutcomes: explain the healing of blind Bartimaeus
discuss lessons learnt from the healing of blind Bartimaeus
apply lessons learnt when faced with health challenges
appreciate the healing power of God in day-to-day life
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm on different sicknesses/challenges that face them
discuss how they involve God when faced with challenges
read Mark 10:46-52 and make notes
discuss lessons learnt from the healing of blind Bartimaeus and share findings with the class
share personal experiences of how they applied faith in difficult situations
write a prayer on healing
in groups visit people who are sick/have challenges within the school to encourage and pray for them
keyInquiryQuestions: How does the healing of Blind Bartimaeus build your faith in God?

specificLearningOutcomes: describe the miracle of calming the storm
outline lessons learnt from the miracle of calming the storm
identify challenges they face in day-to-day life
apply lessons learnt to overcome challenges in day-to-day life
desire to depend on God when faced with challenges
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm on the meaning of the word, storm
share experiences of challenging situations they have faced either as individuals or family and how they can be overcome
read Mark 4:35-41 or watch a movie on calming the storm
outline lessons learnt from this miracle and make notes
choose a challenging situation affecting young people and role-play it in class (the role-play should also include solutions)
compose and sing a song about, overcoming the storms of life
write a personal journal on how they depend on God in day-to-day life
read and meditate on Psalms 91:1-6
keyInquiryQuestions: How does the miracle of calming the storm relate to challenges facing Christians today?

specificLearningOutcomes: describe the healing of the paralytic
outline lessons learnt from the healing of the paralytic
examine the Pharisees’ opposition to the healing of the paralytic
apply lessons learnt by having faith in God when faced with challenges
appreciate God’s power over sickness and disease
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm on the meaning of the word, paralysis
read and discuss Luke 5:17-26 and make a presentation in class using charts/posters or PowerPoint slides
discuss lessons learnt from the healing of the paralytic and make notes
watch a movie on the healing of the paralytic
buzz on the meaning of the word, blasphemy
brainstorm on reasons why the Pharisees accused Jesus Christ of blasphemy
share personal experiences on instances when they prayed to God for healing
write a personal reflection journal on occasions when God answered their prayers
read, write on a flashcard and meditate on Isaiah 53:4-5
keyInquiryQuestions: How does the healing of the paralytic build your faith in God?

specificLearningOutcomes: describe the outpouring of the Holy Spirit on the day of Pentecost
analyse ways Christians exemplify the fruit of the Holy Spirit
take part in church activities to foster responsibility
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm on the meaning of ‘the Day of Pentecost.’
share experiences about what they know about the day of Pentecost
read Acts 2: 1-11 and make notes
download and watch a video on the day of Pentecost
use a digital device or a chart to write key points on the day of Pentecost
read Galatians 5: 22-23 and write on flashcards the fruit of the Holy Spirit
sort the flashcards according to the fruits they practise
write a reflection journal on how they practise the fruit of the Holy Spirit
conduct a buzz session and list the activities they do in the church
keyInquiryQuestions: How do you exemplify the fruit of the Holy Spirit?

specificLearningOutcomes: analyse Christian responsibility in helping the needy
take part in a community service activity in the school neighbourhood
describe the role of the church in caring for the vulnerable and needy in the society
practise the teachings of Jesus Christ’s by helping the needy
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm and list people with diverse needs in the community
discuss ways Christians care and help the needy in the society
share experiences on occasions they have helped the needy
collect pictures of people showing acts of compassion, make a collage and display in class
read Leviticus 19:32-33, Psalms 82:3, Matthew 25:35-46, and make a class presentation on lessons learnt
as a class, organise a visit to the less fortunate, write a detailed report of your visitation, activities done, and lessons learnt and present it in hard copy or PowerPoint slides
keyInquiryQuestions: Why should Christians show compassion to the needy?
pcis: Skills building-helping people with special needs

specificLearningOutcomes: outline roles played by different family members
identify practices which depict healthy family relationships
identify causes of conflicts in families today
examine Christian teachings on healthy family relationships
desire to live harmoniously with members of the family
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm on the responsibilities of parents/guardians, children and other members of the family
discuss practices of a healthy family today
debate on the causes of conflicts in families today
discuss how peer pressure can cause conflict in families today
find out ways to overcome peer influence/rebellion against parents
research on possible solutions to family conflicts
read and discuss Ephesians 6:1-4, Exodus 20:12, Colossians 3:20 and outline lessons learnt
keyInquiryQuestions: How should family members relate with each other?

specificLearningOutcomes: identify forms of sexual abuse and how to avoid/overcome abuse
evaluate causes of teenage pregnancies today
examine the consequences of engaging in irresponsible sexual behaviour
discuss values and life skills needed to avoid irresponsible sexual behaviour
choose to live responsibly as guided by the word of God
suggestedLearningExperiences: discuss the meaning of human sexuality and share findings in the class
research on forms of sexual abuse and make presentations using PowerPoint slides or charts
list places or settings they should avoid for their own safety
discuss ways and where to report cases of sexual abuse
listen and ask a child protection officer (CPO) questions on what to do in case of defilement

debate on the topic, ‘Overcoming peer pressure as a youth.’

read and reflect on 1 Peter 2:11

specificLearningOutcomes: explain the meaning of sacredness of life
discuss how the right to life is violated today
evaluate causes of suicide in the society today
examine causes of abortion among the youth today
analyse the consequences of violating the right to life
desire to uphold the sacredness of life in day-to-day life

discuss why killing is morally wrong
brainstorm on reasons which cause some youths to commit suicide

specificLearningOutcomes: identify causes of bullying at school and in the community
analyse the effects of bullying on the individual and the family
discuss values needed to co-exist peacefully at home, school and the community

specificLearningOutcomes: identify his/her God-given talents, gifts and abilities
take part in different activities at home, school and in the community to nurture talents
apply lessons learnt from the parable of talents in day-to-day life

demonstrate accountability by saving money from the enterprise
suggestedLearningExperiences: brainstorm what they enjoy doing while at home, school and in the community
share experiences of the talents, gifts and unique abilities they possess
showcase the gifts/abilities/talents they possess (for example; they can role-play, dramatise a play or Bible story, draw, sing, paint, compose and recite poems)
read and recite James 1:17, Romans 11:29 and discuss lessons learnt from the scriptures
participate in various activities/competitions (drawing, painting, singing, knitting, sports, acting, preaching) and write a report for presentation in class

pcis: Parental Empowerment and Engagement-Talents and careers
